channel.title: Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks
channel.description:
@onion_knight in https://forums.whonix.org/t/whonix-desktop-installer-with-calamares-field-report/7350/109
[quote="onion_knight, post:109, topic:7350"] * Even with these settings and contrary to previous versions, **I was not able to successfully start the VMs, both using the ISO and the installed version of Whonix-Host, both in KVM and on real hardware!** The error is now: `Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks` I have no idea what causes that and what it means. Needs further exploration. [/quote]

item.title: Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Theoretically performance.Your system seeks to be missing the kernel support for it it is not the fault of the config as this feature has been around since forever and is supported elsewhere.

Read full topic
item.source: Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks

item.title: Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks
item.dc:creator: xuy
item.description:
Yeah, paravaritual spinlocks. Ok, I have disabled them by editing xml, it works without them but i’m not sure, would it affect security/performance? And is this problem related to my system or xml preconfigured in bad way?

Read full topic

item.title: Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
xuy:

I have the same problem

@xuy What problem? If its pvspinlocks just edit it out. I’ll add this to the known problems section if that’s the case.

Read full topic

item.title: Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks
item.dc:creator: xuy
item.description:
I have the same problem but enabling Copy cpu host configuration doesn’t help. Domain had been set to “kvm” already. Using Arch with virt-manager.

Read full topic
item.source: Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks

item.title: Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks
item.dc:creator: onion_knight
item.description:
I confirm the error ceases when using domain type=‘kvm’ instead of ‘qemu’.
Fixed.

Read full topic
item.source: Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks

item.title: Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks
item.dc:creator: onion_knight
item.description:
Maybe caused by the same issue: VMs do no start until the CPU configuration is set to “Copy host CPU configuration”
Will try to test tomorrow and see if it works once the domain type is changed from ‘qemu’ to ‘kvm’.

Read full topic
item.source: Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks

item.title: Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks
item.dc:creator: onion_knight
item.description:
No, this only happens using the Whonix-Host system.
This is probably related to this commit:

github.com/Whonix/whonix-libvirt

re-enable pvspinlock

by HulaHoopWhonix on 06:04PM - 09 Jul 19 UTC
changed 1 files with 1 additions and 1 deletions.

pvspinlock was set to on.
All my physical machines (on debian buster btw) were configured before this change, so they are not affected by this.
I will try to change this setting to ‘on’ on my debian buster machines to see if it also fails.
Meanwhile, reverting this setting to ‘off’ solved the problem on the Whonix-Host system (more on this later, still testing).

Read full topic
item.source: Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks

item.title: Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Did this also happen for you if you used KVM “normally” “as a normal user” as per the usual instructions on https://www.whonix.org/wiki/KVM on Debian buster hosts?

Read full topic
item.source: Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks

item.title: Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
@onion_knight in Whonix Desktop Installer with Calamares - field report

Whonix Desktop Installer with Calamares - field report
  • Even with these settings and contrary to previous versions, I was not able to successfully start the VMs, both using the ISO and the installed version of Whonix-Host, both in KVM and on real hardware! The error is now: Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks
    I have no idea what causes that and what it means. Needs further exploration.

Read full topic
item.source: Error starting domain: unsupported configuration: host doesn't support paravirtual spinlocks
